headline: V.F. Corporation (VFC): A Bull Case Theory
summary: We came across a bullish thesis on V.F. Corporation on Matt McClintock Retail/Consumer Research – M Squared Capital’s Substack by Matthew McClintock. In this article, we will summarize the bulls’ thesis on VFC. V.F. Corporation’s share was trading at $20.10 as of February 5th. VFC’s trailing and forward P/E were 37.16 and 18.42 respectively according to Yahoo Finance. V.F. Corporation, together with its subsidiaries, offers branded apparel, footwear, and accessories for men, women, and children

headline: Should Deckers’ Upbeat Guidance and HOKA Super Shoes Prompt Portfolio Moves From Deckers Outdoor (DECK) Investors?
summary: Deckers Outdoor recently reported higher quarterly and nine‑month sales and earnings, completed a multi‑year share repurchase program totaling about US$2.98 billion, and issued guidance calling for full‑year net sales between US$5.40 billion and US$5.43 billion and diluted EPS of US$6.80 to US$6.85 for the year ending March 31, 2026. Alongside these results, the company’s HOKA brand pushed deeper into performance running with the launch of the Cielo X1 3.0 super shoe and the upcoming...
